question: Which of the following is NOT a pillar of OOP?
What does encapsulation in OOP refer to?
options: Binding data with methods that manipulate the data
Hiding the implementation details of an object
Creating multiple instances of a class
Inheriting properties and behavior from another class

question: Inheritance allows a class to:
options: Access private members of another class

question: Which keyword is used to prevent a class from being inherited?
Polymorphism in OOP is best described as:
options: Having multiple methods with the same name but different parameters
An object's ability to take on many forms
The process of creating objects from classes
Hiding the internal state and requiring interaction through public methods

question: What is the primary purpose of an abstract class in OOP?
options: To prevent the instantiation of a class
To provide a blueprint for other classes to inherit and implement
To encapsulate private data within a class

question: Which of the following is a feature of interface in Java?
options: An interface cannot be implemented by a class.
An interface can extend multiple interfaces.

question: Which concept refers to the ability of an object to take many forms?
In OOP, What is a constructor used for?
options: Defining the methods of a class
Providing an interface to access private members

question: Which OOP principle promotes code reusability by allowing a new class to inherit properties and behavior from an existing class?
Which of the following best defines an object in OOP?
options: An instance of a class that represents a real-world entity
A set of methods without any data
A variable that holds primitive data types
A function that performs specific operations

question: What is the concept of method overloading in OOP?
options: Providing multiple methods with the same name but different return types
Redefining a method in a subclass
Writing methods with the same name but different parameters
Hiding the internal details of a method

question: What does the term 'super' refer to in Java?
options: It points to the superclass constructor.
It represents the current object instance.
It invokes the method of the current class.
It refers to a static method of the class.

question: Which keyword is used in Java to implement method overriding?
What is the main difference between an abstract class and an interface in Java?
options: An abstract class can have both abstract and concrete methods, while an interface can only have abstract methods.
An interface can have constructors, while an abstract class cannot.
An abstract class cannot be inherited, while an interface can be inherited.
An abstract class can have multiple inheritance, while an interface cannot.

question: Which principle in OOP suggests that a subclass object can be used wherever a superclass object is expected?
What is the purpose of the 'this' keyword in Java?
options: It refers to the current instance of the class.
It is used to initialize static variables.

question: In OOP, What is the term used for creating a new class by extending an existing class?
Which OOP concept is used to implement code reuse by allowing a new class to contain properties and methods of an existing class?
What is the significance of the 'static' keyword in Java?
options: It is used to create constant variables.
It indicates that a variable or method belongs to the class rather than to the instances.
It defines a method that can be overridden in subclasses.
It is used to allocate memory for an object.

What is the recommended duration for moderate-intensity aerobic exercise for adults per week?
Which of the following is an anaerobic exercise?
In which sport would you perform a slam dunk?
What is the purpose of the warm-up phase in a workout?
options: To prepare the body for exercise
